meanings.definition: Loaded with a heavy weight or load.
meanings.sent1: The backpack felt burdened with all the books inside.
meanings.sent2: The donkey looked burdened under the weight of the heavy bags.
meanings.sent3: The tree seemed burdened with too many fruits hanging from its branches.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt burdened with sorrow and grief.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge appeared burdened by the weight of the passing cars.

meanings.definition: Oppressed or troubled with a heavy load.
meanings.sent1: The burdened workers toiled under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent2: She felt burdened by the responsibilities piled on her shoulders.
meanings.sent3: The burdened ant struggled to carry the oversized crumb.
meanings.sent4: His mind was burdened with worries about the future.
meanings.sent5: The burdened clouds threatened to burst with rain.

meanings.definition: Weighed down with a heavy load.
meanings.sent1: The burdened ship struggled to stay afloat in the stormy sea.
meanings.sent2: The burdened branches of the tree sagged under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent3: The burdened bee buzzed slowly back to the hive with a full load of pollen.
meanings.sent4: His shoulders were burdened with the weight of the world.
meanings.sent5: The burdened backpacker trudged along the muddy trail.
